intro: Lesquerella versicolor, commonly known as the variable lesquerella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly in regions of Georgia, Florida, and Alabama. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. Lesquerella versicolor produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, kidney-shaped seeds. This plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitats.
